questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a face-centered cubic (FCC) crystal structure?

answers.a: Atoms are located only at the corners of the cube
answers.b: Atoms are located at the corners and at the center of the cube
answers.c: Atoms are located at the corners and at the center of each face
answers.d: Atoms are located only at the center of the cube

explanations.c: FCC structures have atoms at the corners of the cube and at the center of each face, providing a highly efficient packing arrangement.

questions.question: What is the coordination number of a simple cubic (SC) crystal structure?

explanations.b: A simple cubic structure has a coordination number of 6 as each atom is surrounded by six nearest neighbors.

questions.question: What fraction of an atom at a corner of a unit cell belongs to that cell?

explanations.c: An atom at a corner is shared by 8 neighboring unit cells, so only 1/8th of it belongs to a single unit cell.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the atomic radius (r) and the edge length (a) in a body-centered cubic (BCC) crystal structure?

explanations.b: In a BCC crystal structure, the diagonal across the cube passes through 4 atomic radii, giving the relationship a = 4r/√3.

questions.question: Which crystal structure is known for having the lowest packing efficiency?

explanations.c: The simple cubic structure has the lowest packing efficiency of 52% due to its loose atomic arrangement.

questions.question: How many atoms are present in a single unit cell of a face-centered cubic (FCC) structure?

explanations.c: An FCC unit cell contains 8 corner atoms (each contributing 1/8th) and 6 face atoms (each contributing 1/2), summing to 4 atoms.
